item.title: Laureen add a quote by Tove Jansson
item.description: "I ONLY WANT TO LIVE IN PEACE AND PLANT POTATOES AND DREAM!" -- Tove Jansson

item.title: Laureen add a quote by Elizabeth Barrett Browning
item.description: "How do I love thee? Let me count the ways. I love thee to the depth and breadth and height My soul can reach" -- Elizabeth Barrett Browning

item.title: Laureen add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "But luxury has never appealed to me, I like simple things, books, being alone, or with somebody who understands." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Laureen add a quote by Daphne Du Maurier
item.description: "Happiness is not a possession to be prized, it is a quality of thought, a state of mind." -- Daphne Du Maurier

item.title: Laureen add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "If only there could be an invention that bottled up a memory, like scent. And it never faded, and it never got stale. And then, when one wanted it, the bottle could be uncorked, and it would be like living the moment all over again." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Laureen add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "Men are simpler than you imagine my sweet child. But what goes on in the twisted, tortuous minds of women would baffle anyone." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Laureen add a quote by Daphne du Maurier
item.description: "Women want love to be a novel. Men, a short story." -- Daphne du Maurier

item.title: Laureen add a quote by Cynthia Ozick
item.description: "We often take for granted the very things that most deserve our gratitude." -- Cynthia Ozick
